  • Element
org.apache.juneau.rest.annotation

Annotation Type RestResource


  • @Documented
 @Target(value=TYPE)
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Inherited
public @interface RestResource
    Used to denote that a class is a REST resource and to associate metadata on it.

    Usually used on a subclass of RestServlet, but can be used to annotate any class that you want to expose as a REST resource.

    See Also:
    • Overview > juneau-rest-server > @RestResource

    • Element Detail

      • allowBodyParam

        public abstract String allowBodyParam
        Allow body URL parameter.

        When enabled, the HTTP body content on PUT and POST requests can be passed in as text using the "body" URL parameter.
        For example:

        ?body=(name='John%20Smith',age=45)

        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_allowBodyParam
        Default:
        ""

      • allowedMethodParams

        public abstract String allowedMethodParams
        Allowed method parameters.

        When specified, the HTTP method can be overridden by passing in a "method" URL parameter on a regular GET request.
        For example:

        ?method=OPTIONS

        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_allowedMethodParams
        Default:
        ""

      • allowHeaderParams

        public abstract String allowHeaderParams
        Allow header URL parameters.

        When enabled, headers such as "Accept" and "Content-Type" to be passed in as URL query parameters.
        For example:

        ?Accept=text/json&Content-Type=text/json

        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_allowHeaderParams
        Default:
        ""

      • beanFilters

        public abstract Class<?>[] beanFilters
        Class-level bean filters.

        Shortcut to add bean filters to the bean contexts of the objects returned by the following methods:

        • RestContext.getBeanContext()
        • RestContext.getSerializers()
        • RestContext.getParsers()
        See Also:
        • BeanContext.BEAN_beanFilters
        Default:
        {}

      • callHandler

        public abstract Class<? extends RestCallHandler> callHandler
        REST call handler.

        This class handles the basic lifecycle of an HTTP REST call.

        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_callHandler
        Default:
        org.apache.juneau.rest.RestCallHandler.Null.class

      • children

        public abstract Class<?>[] children
        REST children.

        Defines children of this resource.

        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_children
        Default:
        {}

      • classpathResourceFinder

        public abstract Class<? extends ClasspathResourceFinder> classpathResourceFinder
        Classpath resource finder.

        Used to retrieve localized files from the classpath.

        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_classpathResourceFinder
        Default:
        org.apache.juneau.utils.ClasspathResourceFinder.Null.class

      • clientVersionHeader

        public abstract String clientVersionHeader
        Client version header.

        Specifies the name of the header used to denote the client version on HTTP requests.

        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_clientVersionHeader
        Default:
        ""

      • config

        public abstract String config
        Optional location of configuration file for this servlet.

        The configuration file .

        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        See Also:
        • RestContextBuilder.config(Config)
        Default:
        ""

      • converters

        public abstract Class<? extends RestConverter>[] converters
        Class-level response converters.

        Associates one or more converters with a resource class.

        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_converters
        Default:
        {}

      • defaultAccept

        public abstract String defaultAccept
        Default Accept header.

        The default value for the Accept header if not specified on a request.

        This is a shortcut for using defaultRequestHeaders() for just this specific header.

        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        Default:
        ""

      • defaultCharset

        public abstract String defaultCharset
        Default character encoding.

        The default character encoding for the request and response if not specified on the request.

        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_defaultCharset
        Default:
        ""

      • defaultContentType

        public abstract String defaultContentType
        Default Content-Type header.

        The default value for the Content-Type header if not specified on a request.

        This is a shortcut for using defaultRequestHeaders() for just this specific header.

        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        Default:
        ""

      • defaultRequestHeaders

        public abstract String[] defaultRequestHeaders
        Default request headers.

        Specifies default values for request headers if they're not passed in through the request.

        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_defaultRequestHeaders
        Default:
        {}

      • defaultResponseHeaders

        public abstract String[] defaultResponseHeaders
        Default response headers.

        Specifies default values for response headers if they're not set after the Java REST method is called.

        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_defaultResponseHeaders
        Default:
        {}

      • description

        public abstract String[] description
        Optional servlet description.

        It is used to populate the Swagger description field.
        This value can be retrieved programmatically through the RestRequest.getResourceDescription() method.

        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        • The format is plain-text.
          Multiple lines are concatenated with newlines.
        See Also:
        • RestInfoProvider.getDescription(RestRequest)
        Default:
        {}

      • encoders

        public abstract Class<? extends Encoder>[] encoders
        Compression encoders.

        These can be used to enable various kinds of compression (e.g. "gzip") on requests and responses.

        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_encoders
        Default:
        {}

      • flags

        public abstract String[] flags
        Shortcut for setting properties() of simple boolean types.
        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        • Setting a flag is equivalent to setting the same property to "true".
        Default:
        {}

      • guards

        public abstract Class<? extends RestGuard>[] guards
        Class-level guards.

        Associates one or more RestGuards with all REST methods defined in this class.

        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_guards
        Default:
        {}

      • htmldoc

        public abstract HtmlDoc htmldoc
        Provides HTML-doc-specific metadata on this method.

        Used to customize the output from the HTML Doc serializer.

        @RestResource( path="/addressBook", // Links on the HTML rendition page. // "request:/..." URIs are relative to the request URI. // "servlet:/..." URIs are relative to the servlet URI. // "$C{...}" variables are pulled from the config file. htmldoc=@HtmlDoc( // Widgets for $W variables. widgets={ PoweredByJuneau.class, ContentTypeLinks.class } navlinks={ "up: request:/..", "options: servlet:/?method=OPTIONS", "source: $C{Source/gitHub}/org/apache/juneau/examples/rest/addressbook/AddressBookResource.java", }, aside={ "<div style='max-width:400px;min-width:200px'>", " <p>Proof-of-concept resource that shows off the capabilities of working with POJO resources.</p>", " <p>Provides examples of: </p>", " <ul>", " <li>XML and RDF namespaces", " <li>Swagger documentation", " <li>Widgets", " </ul>", " <p style='text-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;'>Available Content Types</p>", " $W{ContentTypeLinks}", "</div>" }, footer="$W{PoweredByJuneau}" ) )

        See Also:
        • Overview > juneau-rest-server > @HtmlDoc
        Default:
        @org.apache.juneau.rest.annotation.HtmlDoc

      • infoProvider

        public abstract Class<? extends RestInfoProvider> infoProvider
        Configuration property: REST info provider.

        Class used to retrieve title/description/swagger information about a resource.

        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_infoProvider
        Default:
        org.apache.juneau.rest.RestInfoProvider.Null.class

      • logger

        public abstract Class<? extends RestLogger> logger
        REST logger.

        Specifies the logger to use for logging.

        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_logger
        Default:
        org.apache.juneau.rest.RestLogger.Null.class

      • maxInput

        public abstract String maxInput
        The maximum allowed input size (in bytes) on HTTP requests.

        Useful for alleviating DoS attacks by throwing an exception when too much input is received instead of resulting in out-of-memory errors which could affect system stability.

        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_maxInput
        Default:
        ""

      • messages

        public abstract String messages
        Messages. Identifies the location of the resource bundle for this class.
        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_messages
        Default:
        ""

      • mimeTypes

        public abstract String[] mimeTypes
        Configuration property: MIME types.

        Defines MIME-type file type mappings.

        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_mimeTypes
        Default:
        {}

      • paramResolvers

        public abstract Class<? extends RestMethodParam>[] paramResolvers
        Java method parameter resolvers.

        By default, the Juneau framework will automatically Java method parameters of various types (e.g. RestRequest, Accept, Reader).
        This setting allows you to provide your own resolvers for your own class types that you want resolved.

        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_paramResolvers
        Default:
        {}

      • parserListener

        public abstract Class<? extends ParserListener> parserListener
        Parser listener.

        Specifies the parser listener class to use for listening to non-fatal parsing errors.

        See Also:
        • Parser.PARSER_listener
        Default:
        org.apache.juneau.parser.ParserListener.Null.class

      • parsers

        public abstract Class<?>[] parsers
        Parsers.

        If no value is specified, the parsers are inherited from parent class.
        Otherwise, this value overrides the parsers defined on the parent class.

        Use Inherit to inherit parsers defined on the parent class.

        Use None to suppress inheriting parsers defined on the parent class.

        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_parsers
        Default:
        {}

      • partParser

        public abstract Class<? extends HttpPartParser> partParser
        HTTP part parser.

        Specifies the HttpPartParser to use for parsing headers, query/form parameters, and URI parts.

        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_partParser
        Default:
        org.apache.juneau.httppart.HttpPartParser.Null.class

      • partSerializer

        public abstract Class<? extends HttpPartSerializer> partSerializer
        HTTP part serializer.

        Specifies the HttpPartSerializer to use for serializing headers, query/form parameters, and URI parts.

        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_partSerializer
        Default:
        org.apache.juneau.httppart.HttpPartSerializer.Null.class

      • path

        public abstract String path
        Resource path.

        Identifies the URL subpath relative to the parent resource.

        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_path
        Default:
        ""

      • pojoSwaps

        public abstract Class<?>[] pojoSwaps
        Class-level POJO swaps.

        Shortcut to add POJO swaps to the bean contexts of the objects returned by the following methods:

        • RestContext.getBeanContext()
        • RestContext.getSerializers()
        • RestContext.getParsers()
        See Also:
        • BeanContext.BEAN_pojoSwaps
        Default:
        {}

      • properties

        public abstract Property[] properties
        Class-level properties.

        Shortcut for specifying class-level properties on this servlet to the objects returned by the following methods:

        • RestContext.getBeanContext()
        • RestContext.getSerializers()
        • RestContext.getParsers()

        Any of the properties defined on RestContext or any of the serializers and parsers can be specified.

        Property values will be converted to the appropriate type.

        In some cases, properties can be overridden at runtime through the RestResponse.prop(String, Object) method or through an RequestProperties method parameter.

        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        See Also:
        • RestContextBuilder.set(String,Object)
        • RestContextBuilder.set(java.util.Map)
        Default:
        {}

      • renderResponseStackTraces

        public abstract String renderResponseStackTraces
        Render response stack traces in responses.

        Render stack traces in HTTP response bodies when errors occur.

        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_renderResponseStackTraces
        Default:
        ""

      • resourceResolver

        public abstract Class<? extends RestResourceResolver> resourceResolver
        REST resource resolver.

        The resolver used for resolving child resources.

        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_resourceResolver
        Default:
        org.apache.juneau.rest.RestResourceResolver.Null.class

      • responseHandlers

        public abstract Class<? extends ResponseHandler>[] responseHandlers
        Response handlers.

        Specifies a list of ResponseHandler classes that know how to convert POJOs returned by REST methods or set via RestResponse.setOutput(Object) into appropriate HTTP responses.

        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_responseHandlers
        Default:
        {}

      • serializerListener

        public abstract Class<? extends SerializerListener> serializerListener
        Serializer listener.

        Specifies the serializer listener class to use for listening to non-fatal serialization errors.

        See Also:
        • Serializer.SERIALIZER_listener
        Default:
        org.apache.juneau.serializer.SerializerListener.Null.class

      • serializers

        public abstract Class<?>[] serializers
        Serializers.

        If no value is specified, the serializers are inherited from parent class.
        Otherwise, this value overrides the serializers defined on the parent class.

        Use Inherit to inherit serializers defined on the parent class.

        Use None to suppress inheriting serializers defined on the parent class.

        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_serializers
        Default:
        {}

      • siteName

        public abstract String siteName
        Optional site name.

        The site name is intended to be a title that can be applied to the entire site.

        This value can be retrieved programmatically through the RestRequest.getSiteName() method.

        One possible use is if you want to add the same title to the top of all pages by defining a header on a common parent class like so:

        htmldoc=@HtmlDoc( header={ "<h1>$R{siteName}</h1>", "<h2>$R{resourceTitle}</h2>" } )

        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        See Also:
        • RestInfoProvider.getSiteName(RestRequest)
        Default:
        ""

      • staticFileResponseHeaders

        public abstract String[] staticFileResponseHeaders
        Static file response headers.

        Used to customize the headers on responses returned for statically-served files.

        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_staticFileResponseHeaders
        Default:
        {}

      • staticFiles

        public abstract String[] staticFiles
        Static file mappings.

        Used to define paths and locations of statically-served files such as images or HTML documents.

        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_staticFiles
        Default:
        {}

      • produces

        public abstract String[] produces
        Supported accept media types.

        Overrides the media types inferred from the serializers that identify what media types can be produced by the resource.

        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_produces
        Default:
        {}

      • consumes

        public abstract String[] consumes
        Supported content media types.

        Overrides the media types inferred from the parsers that identify what media types can be consumed by the resource.

        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_consumes
        Default:
        {}

      • swagger

        public abstract ResourceSwagger swagger
        Provides swagger-specific metadata on this resource.

        Used to populate the auto-generated OPTIONS swagger documentation.

        Example:

        @RestResource( path="/addressBook", // Swagger info. swagger=@ResourceSwagger({ "contact:{name:'John Smith',email:'john@smith.com'},", "license:{name:'Apache 2.0',url:'http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0.html'},", "version:'2.0',, "termsOfService:'You are on your own.',", "tags:[{name:'Java',description:'Java utility',externalDocs:{description:'Home page',url:'http://juneau.apache.org'}}],", "externalDocs:{description:'Home page',url:'http://juneau.apache.org'}" }) )

        See Also:
        • ResourceSwagger
        • RestInfoProvider.getSwagger(RestRequest)
        Default:
        @org.apache.juneau.rest.annotation.ResourceSwagger

      • title

        public abstract String[] title
        Optional servlet title.

        It is used to populate the Swagger title field.
        This value can be retrieved programmatically through the RestRequest.getResourceTitle() method.

        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        • Corresponds to the swagger field /info/title.
        See Also:
        • RestInfoProvider.getTitle(RestRequest)
        Default:
        {}

      • uriAuthority

        public abstract String uriAuthority
        Resource authority path.

        Overrides the authority path value for this resource and any child resources.

        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_uriAuthority
        Default:
        ""

      • uriContext

        public abstract String uriContext
        Resource context path.

        Overrides the context path value for this resource and any child resources.

        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_uriContext
        Default:
        ""

      • uriRelativity

        public abstract String uriRelativity
        URI-resolution relativity.

        Specifies how relative URIs should be interpreted by serializers.

        See UriResolution for possible values.

        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_uriRelativity
        Default:
        ""

      • uriResolution

        public abstract String uriResolution
        URI-resolution.

        Specifies how relative URIs should be interpreted by serializers.

        See UriResolution for possible values.

        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_uriResolution
        Default:
        ""

      • useClasspathResourceCaching

        public abstract String useClasspathResourceCaching
        Configuration property: Use classpath resource caching.

        When enabled, resources retrieved via RestRequest.getClasspathReaderResource(String, boolean) (and related methods) will be cached in memory to speed subsequent lookups.

        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_useClasspathResourceCaching
        Default:
        ""

      • useStackTraceHashes

        public abstract String useStackTraceHashes
        Use stack trace hashes.

        When enabled, the number of times an exception has occurred will be determined based on stack trace hashsums, made available through the RestException.getOccurrence() method.

        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_useStackTraceHashes
        Default:
        ""

      • debug

        public abstract String debug
        Enable debug mode.

        Enables the following:

        • A message and stack trace is printed to STDERR when BasicRestCallHandler.handleError(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse, Throwable) is called.
        Notes:
        • Supports Default REST SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_debug
        Default:
        ""

      • contextPath

        @Deprecated
public abstract String contextPath
        Deprecated. Use uriContext()
        Default:
        ""
